verbs.description: youthen (third-person singular simple present youthens, present participle youthening, simple past and past participle youthened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make younger or more youthful.
examples: It youthened her, melted the stark, hungry grip about her mouth.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become younger or more youthful.
examples: He nods, time traveling to a point when there were no central lines, no low blood counts, no immunosuppressive drugs. His face youthens momentarily as he bridges back to a point on a timeline that has none of this devastation on it.
